author: Thomas Seal
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada will aim to double its exports to markets outside the US by 2035 to net an extra C$300 billion ($214 billion) in trade.
title: Carney Sets Goal of Doubling Canada’s Non-US Exports in a Decade

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Zahra Hirji
description: As the US government shutdown hurtles through a fourth week, the main source of federal funding for disaster relief efforts is running critically low, according to people familiar with the matter and an internal report reviewed by Bloomberg.
title: Disaster Relief Fund Hits Critical Low as Shutdown Endures

author: Yian Lee, Miaojung Lin, Eric Martin
description: Taiwanese officials are courting podcasters and influencers aligned with Donald Trump as they grow more worried the US leader could undermine the self-ruled democracy’s interests in talks with China, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Taiwan Is Courting MAGA Influencers to Get Trump’s Attention

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: Donald Trump said he planned to speak to Xi Jinping about China’s purchases of Russian oil when the two leaders meet next week in South Korea, after the US president on Wednesday announced fresh sanctions on top energy companies with ties to the Kremlin.
title: Trump Says He’ll Raise China’s Russian Oil Purchases With Xi

author: Olga Kharif
description: About a dozen crypto industry leaders including Coinbase Global Inc. Chief Executive Officer Brian Armstrong and Chainlink Labs’ Sergey Nazarov met with Democratic and Republican leaders Wednesday for almost three hours to discuss market-structure legislation.
title: Crypto Leaders Hit Capitol Hill to Push Market Structure Bill

author: Gerson Freitas Jr, Skylar Woodhouse
description: The Trump administration released a plan to encourage ranching and boost domestic beef production, as it separately raised a quota for Argentine beef imports.
title: US Unveils Plan to Bolster Beef Output, Raises Argentine Quota

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: Gavekal Dragonomics’ Arthur Kroeber joins Trumponomics to discuss how the latest tit-for-tat reveals Beijing’s growing leverage in its standoff with Washington.
title: Why China Is Gaining the Upper Hand in Trump’s Trade War

author: Catherine Lucey
description: Donald Trump is demolishing the entire East Wing of the White House to build a $200 million ballroom at the property, a senior White House official said, a move that exceeds the original scope of the project as described by the president.
title: Trump to Demolish Entire East Wing to Build White House Ballroom

author: Myles Miller
description: The Trump administration is sending more than 100 federal officers to a military base outside of San Francisco, a person familiar said, days after President Donald Trump singled out the city as the next target of his federal crime crackdown.
title: Trump Deploys Border Agents to San Francisco Area in Crackdown

author: Janet Lorin, Liam Knox
description: The University of Virginia became the latest college to strike a deal with the Trump administration, settling civil rights investigations that threatened the school’s federal funding and cost its former president his job.
title: White House Strikes Deal With University of Virginia Over Probes

author: Catherine Lucey, Skylar Woodhouse
description: The US announced sanctions on Russia’s biggest oil producers, the Trump administration’s strongest bid so far to pressure President Vladimir Putin to negotiate an end to the war in Ukraine.
title: US Sanctions Russia’s Rosneft, Lukoil in Push for Ukraine Talks

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to announce that his government’s upcoming budget will introduce an immigration plan that includes a talent attraction strategy.
title: Carney Plots ‘Talent Attraction’ Plan as US Upends H-1B Process

author: Erik Wasson
description: Democrats and Republicans both see their messages winning.
title: Why Deadlock in Congress Has the US Headed for a Record Shutdown

author: Jorge Valero
description: European Union countries have reached an agreement on a new package of sanctions targeting Russia — including an import ban on liquefied natural gas — that are expected to be adopted Thursday morning.
title: EU Russia Sanctions That Hit LNG Imports to Be Adopted Thursday

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: Israel needs to do “much more” to help the people of Gaza, a United Nations official said Wednesday, even as the flow of aid has increased since Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government signed a ceasefire deal with Hamas.
title: UN Says Israel Needs to Do More to Let Gaza Aid Through

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: The US plans to announce a “substantial” increase in sanctions related to Russia within the next day, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced.
title: White House to Ratchet Up Russia Sanctions, Bessent Says

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Argentina’s economy posted a slight monthly expansion in August despite a liquidity crunch in a win for President Javier Milei ahead of a critical midterm election this weekend.
title: Argentina’s Economy Posts Slight Growth Ahead of Midterm Vote

author: Molly Smith
description: An advocacy group for statisticians urged House lawmakers to strike a provision in a spending bill that would restrict the Census Bureau’s ability to repeatedly contact respondents, cautioning the proposal could hamper the accuracy and reliability of government statistics.
title: Congress Urged to Scrap Proposed Curb on Census Data Collection

author: Alicia Diaz, Erik Wasson
description: Members of the ultra-conservative House Freedom Caucus and at least one influential Republican chairman are pushing for a long-term stopgap spending bill as part of their strategy to end the ongoing US government shutdown.
title: Republicans Divided Over Next Steps to End US Shutdown

author: Courtney McBride
description: The US military struck a suspected drug-trafficking boat in the eastern Pacific Ocean on Tuesday, expanding a controversial campaign against cartels that had been so far limited to the Caribbean Sea.
title: US Military Widens Anti-Drug Campaign With Strike in Pacific

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump attacked US cattle ranchers over their criticism of his plan to slash record beef prices by importing more meat from Argentina, deepening a quarrel over his trade policy with a group of reliable supporters.
title: Trump Demands Cattle Ranchers Lower Prices, Deepening Feud

author: Catherine Lucey
description: The Trump administration is weighing export restrictions against China that would bar the purchase of a wide swath of critical software, a White House official said Wednesday.
title: US Considers Broad Software Curbs on China, White House Says

author: Madison Muller, Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Jordan Fabian
description: President Donald Trump is planning to launch a new investigation into drug prices aimed at ensuring foreign countries pay as much as Americans do for their medicines, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Eyes Fresh Tariff Probe Focused on Foreign Drug Prices

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The Houthis have freed a number of foreign United Nations employees who had been detained last weekend after the militant group stormed a compound in the Yemeni capital.
title: Houthis Release Foreign United Nations Staff Detained in Yemen

author: Pius Lukong
description: Cameroon’s Constitutional Council declined to rule on a series of petitions alleging irregularities in this month’s presidential elections, paving the way for the top court to announce the results of the Oct. 12 vote.
title: Top Cameroon Court Declines Jurisdiction on Election Petitions

author: Damian Shepherd
description: The UK is planning a package of emergency measures to boost housebuilding in London that could be announced as soon as Thursday.
title: UK to Announce Emergency Measures to Boost London Building

author: Jorge Valero
description: A majority of European Union countries, including Germany and France, are calling for a systematic review of the bloc’s regulations by the end of the year to dismantle old rules that pose challenges for the competitiveness of its companies.
title: Majority of EU Nations Seek to Dismantle Bloc’s Outdated Rules

author: Augusta Saraiva, Daniel Carvalho, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Donald Trump is interested in meeting Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and officials are discussing a possible meeting while the pair are in Malaysia for the Association of Southeast Asian Nations, according to a White House official.
title: Trump, Lula Seek Meeting in Malaysia as Brazil Eyes Tariff Cut

author: Nicolle Yapur
description: The Argentine peso strengthened, snapping a five-day losing streak amid continued market intervention by both the local and US governments.
title: Argentina Peso Snaps Five-Day Losing Streak Amid FX Intervention

author: Dan Williams
description: US Vice President JD Vance and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu met on Wednesday to discuss plans for a postwar Gaza, with the allies trying to maintain and look beyond a truce in the shattered Palestinian territory.
title: Israel, US Brainstorm Gaza ‘Day-After’ as Shaky Truce Continues

author: Heesu Lee, Shery Ahn, Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korea and the US are focusing on the structure of a $350 billion investment pledge by Seoul, rather than a currency swap, according to Finance Minister Koo Yun Cheol.
title: Korea-US Talks Focusing on $350 Billion Pledge, Not FX Swap

author: Ntando Thukwana, Rivaldo Jantjies
description: A top South African banker criticized the nation’s Black economic empowerment laws as a misfire that’s failed to spread wealth or opportunity after more than three decades.
title: Top Banker Slams South Africa’s Black Empowerment Laws for Being Misapplied

author: Christopher Jungstedt, Charlie Duxbury
description: Sweden and Ukraine signed a deal paving the way to supply the war-torn nation with as many as 150 Saab fighter jets, sending the Swedish company’s shares higher.
title: Sweden Agrees Plan to Sell as Many as 150 Jets to Ukraine

author: Eric Martin
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio plans to travel to Israel this week to help reinforce a fragile, US-brokered ceasefire agreed to with Hamas earlier this month.
title: Rubio to Visit Israel as US Works to Bolster Gaza Ceasefire

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero
description: The European Union is working on trade options to counter China’s planned export controls on critical raw materials should the bloc fail to reach a diplomatic solution with Beijing.
title: EU Prepares Trade Options to Counter China Rare Earth Curbs

author: Slav Okov
description: Bulgaria’s ruling coalition ditched plans to reshuffle its minority government, narrowly avoiding a political crisis less than three months before the Balkan country adopts the euro.
title: Bulgarian Government Avoids Reshuffle Before Euro Adoption

author: Jorge Valero, John Ainger, Daniel Hornak
description: European Union leaders are expected to greenlight a 19th Russia sanctions package at a summit on Thursday after Slovakia dropped its objections.
title: EU Leaders to Approve New Russia Sanctions With LNG Ban

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said the Italian government is ready to help train future Palestinian police and political leaders, and contribute to the reconstruction of the Gaza Strip.
title: Meloni Says Italy Is Ready to Help Rebuild Gaza, Train Police

author: Amara Omeokwe, Jonnelle Marte
description: When Federal Reserve officials met last month, investors were convinced the first interest-rate cut of 2025 was coming. But what, many wondered, would Governor Christopher Waller do?
title: Waller, a Top Fed Chair Contender, Backs Rate Cuts Without Bowing to Trump

author: Alan Crawford
description: The Dutch government’s seizure of Nexperia has triggered unexpected fallout.
title: Europe Gets Squeezed by Trump-China Rivalry

author: Erik Wasson
description: The US government shutdown, now in its 22nd day, has become the second-longest in history as the stalemate between the two parties over expiring health-care subsidies persists.
title: US Government Shutdown Is Now Second Longest in History

author: Sonia Sirletti
description: UniCredit SpA Chief Executive Officer Andrea Orcel said the Italian lender should be able to mitigate any hit from a plan by the government to raise more money from banks.
title: Orcel Says UniCredit Is Able to Mitigate Hit From Italy Bank Tax

author: Debby Wu, Felix Tam
description: China is demanding some US semiconductor firms submit sensitive information about their sales in the world’s largest chips market as part of its probe of American suppliers.
title: China Seeks Sensitive Data From US Firms in Semiconductor Probe

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Lithuanian Defense Minister Dovile Sakaliene resigned Wednesday following public clashes with the prime minister, escalating a crisis within the Baltic nation’s fragile ruling coalition.
title: Lithuanian Defense Minister Resigns Over Clashes With Premier

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Randy Thanthong-Knight
description: One of Thailand’s most high-profile politicians allegedly linked to transnational scam operations has said he will step down.
title: Thai Deputy Finance Minister Quits Over Scam Center Allegations

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Russia launched multiple drone and missile strikes on Ukraine as the latest peace attempts by US President Donald Trump appeared to be floundering.
title: Russia Hits Ukraine as Trump’s Latest Peace Efforts Falter

author: Masaki Kondo
description: Dollar trading has become unusually subdued, with one measure showing it’s the quietest in more than a decade, as a potential US government shutdown coincides with political tensions abroad, adding complexity to currency risk.
title: Dollar Goes Into Hibernation With Range Near Tightest Since 2013

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Lithuania’s Vilnius Airport resumed operations Wednesday morning after the airspace was closed overnight due to weather balloons with smuggled cigarettes crossing the border from neighboring Belarus.
title: Lithuania’s Vilnius Airport Reopens After Smuggler Balloon Halt

author: Zoe Tillman, Chris Strohm
description: A Florida federal judge has empaneled a grand jury for January that a close Donald Trump ally recently suggested is related to a criminal investigation into allegations of a long-running Democratic conspiracy against the president.
title: Trump Ally Pushing Conspiracy Case Says Grand Jury Review Coming

author: Isabel Reynolds
description: Sanae Takaichi’s rise marks a milestone, but women in Japan still struggle to enter politics, lead corporations, or share in some of its most revered traditions.
title: Japan Has Its First Woman Leader. Just Don’t Ask Her About Feminism

author: Nasreen Seria
description: India and the US are nearing a trade deal that could lower tariffs on Indian exports to 15%–16% from about 50%, the Mint newspaper reported, citing three unidentified people aware of the matter.
title: US May Cut India Tariff Rate to 15-16% in Trade Deal, Mint Says
